It has been over a year since Congress first asked for this investigation, and now the public needs to know the status and findings. Every day that the FCC delays reporting their findings puts consumers‚Äô personal security at greater risk.

That means that for just a few dollars, stalkers and predatory abusers can buy geolocation information that has made its way to the black market to prey on unsuspecting victims -- a reality that should set off alarm bells nationwide.
Location data is sold through a supply chain with little oversight, which can often lead to this information ending up in the hands of bad actors.

We have an obligation to safeguard those who answer the call to service by confronting the root causes of sexual assault in the military.

The body would advise the secretary on ways to implement new or improve existing programs dedicated to preventing sexual assault & would be comprised of members with expertise in campus sexual assault, suicide prevention, public health, and culture change of large organizations.

My second amendment incorporated legislation that I introduced earlier this week ‚Äî the bipartisan & bicameral ‚ÄúPrevention of Sexual Assault in the Armed Forces Act.‚Äù This bill directs the Secretary of Defense to create a civilian advisory committee on sexual assault prevention.

This means that teachers and counselors can better identify students who may need additional support, and provide invaluable data for educators, parents, and policymakers to better understand academic outcomes of military connected students.
